intro: Torminaria clusii, commonly known as the Clusi's torminaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and simple, alternate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
